intro: Acronia aurita, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Acronia aurita thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a distinctive addition to botanical gardens.
